page.title: 05ATTITUDES IN LORTON
page.content: The Planning Board is often critised for the inconsistency of its decisions. Dissatisfaction is felt because members appointed to the Board by the County Council for their political views are men who do not live in the National Park and do not represent the residents. The unspoiledness is jealously guarded by articulate residents. A proposal to make Lorton Hall an outdoor pursuits centre was refused planning permission after public protest. Some people dislike the Caravan Club rallies and the Girl Guide camp. A folk festival was not repeated after protests. Low flying military aircraft cause sudden, frightening noise which is mostly tolerated as a necessary evil. Farm animals have become used to it. The nearness of the Atomic Power Plant at Sellafield disturbs only a minority.
